chapter10

Class Circle

  • java.lang.Object
    • chapter10.Shape
      • chapter10.Circle

  • public class Circle
extends Shape

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Circle()
      Circle initializes the radius field to 1 if no argument is given.
      Circle(Circle circle)
      Circle makes a copy of the circle object and assigns it to the radius.
      Circle(double r)
      Circle takes a double parameter and it checks that the input is more than 1 if so it initializes radius to the parameter otherwise it initializes radius to 1
      Circle(java.lang.String r)
      Circle takes a string as a parameter.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double calcArea()
      getArea calculates and returns the area of a circle by multiplying PI * radius squared
      boolean equals(Circle circle)
      equals compares two Circle objects and returns true if the values of the objects are the same false if they are not
      double getCircumference()
      getCircumference calculates and returns the circumference of a circle by multiplying the diameter of the circle * PI
      double getDiameter()
      getDiameter calculates and return the diameter of a circle by multiplying radius * 2
      static int getNumInstance()
      getNumInstance return the number of instances of the class
      double getRadius()
      getRadius returns the value of the radius field
      void setRadius(double r)
      setRadius takes a double parameter and it checks that the input is more than 1 if so it sets radius to the parameter otherwise it sets radius to 1
      void setRadius(java.lang.String r)
      setRadius takes a string as a parameter.
      java.lang.String toString()
      toString creates a message to be displayed

        equals, getSides, setSides

      • Circle

        public Circle(double r)
        Circle takes a double parameter and it checks that the input is more than 1 if so it initializes radius to the parameter otherwise it initializes radius to 1
        Parameters:
        r - - the radius of a circle as a double

      • Circle

        public Circle(java.lang.String r)
        Circle takes a string as a parameter. It converts it to a double before checking if its greater than 1 if so it initializes radius to the parameter otherwise it initializes radius to 1
        Parameters:
        r - - the radius of a circle as a String

        public void setRadius(java.lang.String r)
